Instruction: Mix together flour, egg yolks, sour cream, sugar, softened butter, rum, and salt in a large bowl until a dough forms.

Knead the dough gently, then roll it out on a floured surface. Cut the dough into 4-inch long and 3/4-inch wide strips. Make a slit in the middle of each strip, then twist and pull one end through the slit.
Fry a few pastry twists at a time in the hot oil until golden brown and crisp. Drain on paper towels before serving.

Fry the pastry twists in batches until they turn golden brown, approximately 1 minute per side. Remove and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain. Sprinkle confectioners' sugar over the twists.

The nutritional value of oil for frying is calculated based on a retention value of 10% after cooking, but the exact amount may vary depending on cook time, temperature, ingredient density, and the specific type of oil used.
